subject: Investing
title: Tokenomics: Supply, Demand, and Value
description: A quick, practical guide to Tokenomics: Supply, Demand, and Value.

hook.text: Two tokens had the same market cap. One had 10 million coins; the other had 10 billion. Same value? Not at all.

buildup.text: Tokenomics studies supply schedules, inflation rates, burn mechanisms, and distribution fairness.

discovery.text: A token with high inflation dilutes holders. A deflationary token with real demand creates scarcity value.

twist.text: Insider allocations matter: if founders hold 40% and can sell anytime, retail investors bear the exit risk.

climax.text: Check vesting schedules, circulating vs. total supply, and whether revenues flow back to token holders.

punchline.text: Price is what you pay. Tokenomics determines what you get.

quiz.question: Why do vesting schedules matter in tokenomics?
options: They reveal when insiders can sell, affecting price pressure
